titleStmt.title: Syntha Carpenter and Julyan M Hughs to Unknown
CWG9193

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To the Govenor of Kentucky yore Petioners of Carter County Syntha Carpenter and Julyan M Hughs has been find ten Dollars Each on a Charge of a Breech of the Peace and We the under signed do not Believe that they are Gilty of the Charge and want for you to remit the fine as they are Poore and unable to Pay and if they are required to Pay they will have to Goe Jail and We the under signed think it Just and rite for you to remit the fine the fine was assesed before James Garvin a Justice of the Peace for Carter County & in October 1862 in Duty Bond Will Ever Prey at yore hands

Signers Names
A A underwood
W B Powers
R R Evans
E H, Evans
Z: Evans
Joshua Knappe
George L Anderson
David S. Peterson
Signers Names
Alexander Jewell
George W Underwood
Henry Roloan
James Jewell
W. H Gegan
M P Mayne
A Walker
A under wood
Henry Underwood
William A Langdown
Isaac Garvin
M D Moore
Sylvester C Evet
R S. Glover
W Underwood
James Underwood
Jn McGeer
Thomas Smith
Wm W Moore

I am well acquainted with yore Petioners and and the accused breech of the Peace and think they ought to be Pardend they are Poore and has a Widow Mother to Suport and has nothing to spare to Pay a fine and if required to Pay they will have to goe to Jail to Pay the fine.
I am no relation to the Parties or attorney or intrusted in the matter I Believe from the Proof that they ought not to have been find yore friend with respects Send to olive hill Carter County Ky
